etymology.description: semantic 止 (“foot”) + phonetic 丁; original form of 征 “to go on long campaign”.
etymology.interpretation: The graphic combines the idea of a foot (movement, marching) with 丁 to cue the sound zhèng. Early use referred to marching on campaign, with the top horizontal stroke reflecting a compressed 丁 in later forms. Meanings later shifted and broadened to senses like straight, proper, and correct.

examples.chinese: 他的为人很正(他的為人很正)。
请把画挂正(請把畫掛正)。
我们从正门进去(我們從正門進去)。
examples.english: We will enter through the main gate.
